info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 8:02AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A LINE OF SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON... NORTHWESTERN INDIANA...SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...NORTHERN ALLEGHENY... SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND ARMSTRONG COUNTIES... At 759 AM EDT, a line of snow showers was located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Rimersburg to near Sarver to Imperial. Movement was east at 40 mph. A brief wind gust to around 30 MPH is possible with these snow showers, and visibility may briefly drop to less than one mile. A quick coating of snow is also possible on roads. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Punxsutawney, Vandergrift, Kittanning, Apollo, and Shaler Township. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 34 and 57. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 60 and 73. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 51 and 61, and between mile markers 69 and 84. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
